name: Howard Stern
religion: Stern was raised Jewish and still claims Judaism, but he seems rather skeptical of organized religion.
politicalViews: Stern is a Libertarian and even ran for governor of New York on the Libertarian ticket. All in all, though, he seems politically confused.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Howard Stern was born and raised in New York City, New York.

content.sourceTitle: Jewish Or Not: Is Howard Stern Jewish?
content.text: He comes from a full-on Jewish family, both of his parents are children of Austro-Hungarian Jewish immigrants.
Now, Stern doesn't seem too enchanted with his inherited religion and is sometimes labeled as a "self-hating Jew."
These critiques don't seem too off the mark, especially when Stern goes on about what he considers ridiculous Jewish rituals, such as fasting,
or speaking Hebrew in English speaking countries,
or circumcision. Of that, he said:

I don't know where this circumcision came from, some people feel it's a religious thing, it's about health, it's about cutting off the foreskin makes your penis less likely to get cancer. There's been all kinds of myths. I think it's nonsense. That if you're born that way, it seems to me it's a mutilation to cut it off.

content.sourceTitle: Why don't Jews eat pork? According to Howard Stern Part 1.
content.text: But I don't think Stern is a self-hating Jew. I think he sees religion as an institution as ridiculous. He once articulated that the Bible was not written by God, but was more functional in its uses. Really, it was a moral framework to try and stop people from raping and burning down villages and whatnot.
Furthermore, he thinks religious practices are superfluous, saying:
I just think being a good person and trying to do your best [is what's important]… [with religion] you've got to bow and all sorts of [ritual].

content.sourceTitle: Clips From Last Night: Howard Stern on his father, politics and… Miley Cyrus – Piers Morgan
content.text: Stern's job is to rile people up. To do this, he'll say anything on the air. He's known for being outlandish and provocative. As a result, it's difficult to know his real political positions. He did run as governor of New York as a Libertarian and was showing 28% approval rate in the polls before dropping out.
And in true Libertarian form, he endorsed presidential candidate Ron Paul in 2008,
but didn't seem to like him anymore in 2012, calling him a "lunatic" and "on the fringe."

He has admitted to voting for both Republicans and Democrat, but the bulk of his ire seems to go to Democrats, because they are usually the one's behind "political correctness" movements and media censorship–something Stern has been particularly tormented by. After a tiff with the FCC, Stern said:

content.sourceTitle: Howard Stern swears off "F'ing Democrats" Forever
content.text: I've voted Republican and I've voted Democrat. I have vowed I will never vote for a Democrat again. I don't give a fuck. No matter who they are… The facts are these Democrats at the FCC are Communists… they're for communism.

Strong words… and reminiscent of unfounded Republican criticisms of Obama. But put it all together, and Stern seems politically confused–which is often a good way for Libertarians to be. They are sort of the party of people who are passionate about politics but don't fit into the Democrat/Republican paradigm.
